diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Gangrenous cholecystitis and large umbilical hernia.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with right upper quadrant abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting, along with a history of cholelithiasis (gallstones) which indicated possible complications like cholecystitis. The ultrasound findings of moderately distended gallbladder with wall edema and pericholecystic fluid further supported the diagnosis of gangrenous cholecystitis.
